title: Fragment, 16th–17th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: cut and uncut supplementary warp pile (velvet) in a woven foundation
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Fragment of gray-blue and rose cut and uncut velvet on a ground shot with metallic thread in a small-scale pattern of palmettes and flowers.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, 16th–17th century. Medium: silk
Technique: cut and uncut supplementary warp pile (velvet) in a woven foundation. 
Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-56-133
